DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVES: I. Determine whether parenteral relaxin improves skin tightness, Raynaud's phenomenon, digital morbidity, and digital ulcers in a patient with progressive systemic sclerosis (scleroderma). II. Determine whether relaxin decreases collagen production by fibroblasts in vivo and cultured from skin biopsies.
DOC.brief_title: Phase II Study of Recombinant Relaxin for Progressive Systemic Sclerosis
DOC.detailed_description: PROTOCOL OUTLINE: This is a compassionate use study. The patient is treated with subcutaneous injections of recombinant relaxin for approximately 12 months. If clinically indicated, therapy may be extended.
DOC.criteria: PROTOCOL ENTRY CRITERIA: Disease Characteristics Progressive systemic sclerosis (scleroderma) No pregnant or nursing women
